entry.title: Creating Tor Hidden Services with Python
entry.content:
Introduction

We all know how Tor can be used to protect the anonymity of someone who is trying to connect to a service. However, is it also possible to also use Tor to protect the anonymity of a service provider? The answer is yes, and this is done via hidden services. These services, operating under the .onion TLD, allow publishers to anonymously create and host content viewable by Tor users.

The Tor project has instructions on how to create hidden services manually, but this is no fun. This post will show how we can use the fantastic stem Python library to automatically create and host a Tor hidden service.
